articles.title: The best live TV streaming services to cut cable in 2025
articles.summary: We still think getting a live TV streaming service is a better deal than paying for cable — but the gulf between the two options is narrowing. Now that many of the major providers go for more than $80 per month, it’s not the amazing deal it once was.

articles.title: Neither AI nor E Ink can make touchscreen trackpads a good idea
articles.summary: E Ink, the company behind the highly readable displays you'll find in ereaders the world over, has created a new touchscreen trackpad for some reason. And rather than act as an extension of your laptop's screen, E Ink thinks it should be a dedicated home for AI interactions.

articles.title: Apple iOS 26: All the latest features for iPhone's new operating system, including FaceTime updates
articles.summary: Liquid Glass is a huge new change coming to iOS 26. (Apple) Get ready because Apple iOS 26 (not iOS 19) is headed your way this fall with some cool new features you'll want to try. The fresh home and lock screen redesign we've been waiting to see for years.

articles.title: Anthem is officially shutting down on January 12
articles.summary: EA s beleaguered online shooter Anthem is shutting down for good on January 12, 2026. The game will be removed from the company s storefront ahead of that on August 15. It ll be available for download after that date so long as it s already in your library.

articles.title: Snowflake supercharges Cboe’s analytics and monetization at financial-market scale
articles.summary: Home to one of the world’s largest options exchanges and the well-known VIX volatility index, Cboe Global Markets Inc. operates at a massive data scale, processing hundreds of billions of messages each day.

articles.title: OpenAI, Oracle Expand Stargate Project | Bloomberg Tech 7/3/2025
articles.summary: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow discuss OpenAI's deal with Oracle as they search for more compute capacity. Plus, a look at President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill as it nears a successful House vote. And the White House lifts some chip design software curbs on China.

articles.title: MindsEye dev warns staff about layoffs amid talk of saboteurs and 'relaunch'
articles.summary: Microsoft isn't the only gaming company talking about layoffs this week. MindsEye developer Build a Rocket Boy (BARB) notified around 300 employees that they risk losing their jobs. However, the drama doesn't end there.

articles.title: Telegram blockchain developer startup TOP raises $28.5M at $1B valuation
articles.summary: The Open Platform, a developer of tools for encrypted-messaging app Telegram Messenger Inc. ’s blockchain ecosystem, announced today it raised $28. 5 million in an early-stage funding round, bringing its valuation to $1 billion.

articles.title: Helldivers 2 is coming to Xbox on August 26
articles.summary: Helldivers 2, the third-person co-op shooter developed by Arrowhead Game Studios, is finally coming to Xbox on August 26. The sequel to the 2015 top-down shooter was released for PlayStation 5 and Windows in early 2024 and supports cross-platform play.

articles.title: Why Cloudflare wants AI companies to pay for content
articles.summary: Cloudflare wants AI companies to pay up. The cloud infrastructure provider, which powers around 20% of the web, is launching a new experiment that would let publishers charge AI firms every time their bots scrape a site.

articles.title: Ilya Sutskever will lead Safe Superintelligence following his CEO’s exit
articles.summary: OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever says he stepping into the CEO role at Safe Superintelligence, the AI startup he launched in 2024.

articles.title: Xbox was funding Romero Games' new game, but layoffs have left the project in crisis
articles.summary: Microsoft was rocked by more than 9,000 job cuts this week. A significant number have come from its gaming division, resulting in the closure of multiple game studios and the cancellation of numerous in-development projects at Xbox and its contracted studios.

articles.title: Y Combinator alum launched a new $34M fund dedicated to YC startups, backed by Garry Tan
articles.summary: Kulveer Taggar, a two-time YC alum and founder of Zeus Living, founded Phosphor Capital last year.
